p: Among eosinophils, we observed unsegmented eosinophils that may represent immature eosinophils or a subset of homeostatic eosinophils. Indeed, eosinophils have been perceived for a long time as terminally differentiated cytotoxic and destructive cells but recent studies have demonstrated that eosinophils also exert a variety of essential homeostatic functions and display unique morphological and phenotypical features that unambiguously distinguish them from the inflammatory eosinophils, especially in the lungs ( 14, 15).
